Even if it's not air pollution, ground based pollution is still horrible. I drove by a forest that used to be a beautiful pristine place and has now been fracked and looks like a war zone. Not to mention the ground water pollution that could get into the well water of those who live around there.[/bq]
The reason why I'm more worried about air pollution is that the increase in temperature is reducing arable land thus driving up the cost of food and therefore causing more and more people to go hungry. . . *WAIT* before you go "100% natural" route keep in mind that we're heading towards a mass extinction.  Finding a alternative fuel source would save the most lives.  The good thing about a lot of them is that, unlike fossil fuels, the cost of say solar is going down as technology is advancing.  We're eventually going to reach the point at where say solar is going to undersell oil for powering houses.  The cost of solar power has dropped I believe 60% since 2011.  What is going to wind up happening is that we're going to switch energy sources not cause everyone wants to change the environment, but rather alternative fuel sources' costs are going down whereas oil is only going up.

Tl:dr;  In the long run we're going to sort this out cause alternative fuel sources' costs are going down; cost of oil is only going upwards cause it's not renewable.
